name: Ophidiotaur
description: A large monstrosity with a powerful physique, showcasing serpentine features and armed with a glaive.
memorable: Combines strong melee combat abilities with poison immunity and the ability to summon snakes, enhancing its threat level.
goals: Overwhelm foes in battle using its powerful attacks and summoned allies.
relations: Might command snakes or work alongside other chaotic evil creatures.
environment: Typically found in swamps or areas with large bodies of water.
strengths: High physical prowess, excellent durability, and poison immunity; also has magic resistance.
weaknesses: Low intelligence may limit strategic thinking.
attacks: Makes powerful melee attacks with its bite and poisoned glaive, capable of inflicting both piercing and poison damage.
most_powerful_ability: Charge ability that grants extra slashing damage when moving toward a target.
senses: Has a passive perception of 16, indicating strong awareness of its surroundings.
skills: Proficient in Athletics and Stealth, enabling it to excel in physical encounters.
additional_information: Ability to summon 1d6 poisonous or flying snakes once per day.
Uses chaotic behavior in combat to keep foes guessing.
Strong in melee combat with high damage output.
